Interface Graph<N,E>

  • Type Parameters:
    N - the type of the data to be associated with a node
    E - the type of the data to be associated with an edge
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GraphImplementation

    public interface Graph<N,E>
    A graph, similar in idea to the List interface of the Collections framework. A graph is a conceptually a pair where N is a set of nodes and E is a set of edges, where each edge is an ordered pair where both n1 and n2 are members of N.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  Graph.Edge<N,E>
      Represents an edge in the graph.
      static interface  Graph.Node<N,E>
      Represents a node in a graph.
      static interface  Graph.Processor<N,E>
      A processor for graph traversals.

    • Method Detail

      • getNodes

        java.util.Set<Graph.Node<N,E>> getNodes​()
        Get a new set of all of the nodes in the graph. Changes made to the returned set will not be reflected in the graph, though changes made to particular nodes in the set may be.
        Returns:
        a new set of the nodes in the graph

      • getEdges

        java.util.Set<Graph.Edge<N,E>> getEdges​()
        Get a new set of all of the edges in the graph. Changes made to the returned set will not be reflected in the graph, though changes made to particular edges in the set may be.
        Returns:
        a new set of the edges in the graph

      • findEdge

        Graph.Edge<N,E> findEdge​(Graph.Node<N,E> tail,
                         Graph.Node<N,E> head)
        Find a particular edge given its tail and head.
        Parameters:
        tail - the tail ("from" node) of the edge to be found
        head - the head ("to" node) of the edge to be found
        Returns:
        the edge, or null if there is no such edge

      • numNodes

        int numNodes​()
        Short-cut to get the number of nodes in the graph. This is equivalent to, though not necessarily implemented as, getNodes().size().
        Returns:
        the number of nodes in the graph

      • numEdges

        int numEdges​()
        Short-cut to get the number of edges in the graph. This is equivalent to, though not necessarily implemented as, getEdges().size().
        Returns:
        the number of edges in the graph

      • addNode

        Graph.Node<N,E> addNode​(N data)
        Adds a node to the graph. The new node will have degree 0.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be associated with the node
        Returns:
        the new node

        Parameters:
        tail - the tail ("from" node) of the edge to be added
        head - the head ("to" node) of the edge to be added
        Returns:
        the new edge

      • removeNode

        void removeNode​(Graph.Node<N,E> node)
        Removes a node and all its incident edges from the graph.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if the node does not belong to this graph

      • removeEdge

        void removeEdge​(Graph.Edge<N,E> edge)
        Removes an edge from the graph.
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if the edge does not belong to this graph

      • removeEdge

        void removeEdge​(Graph.Node<N,E> tail,
                Graph.Node<N,E> head)
        Removes an edge from the graph given its tail and head nodes.
        Parameters:
        tail - the tail ("from" node) of the edge to be removed
        to - the head ("to" node) of the edge to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if either the tail or head nodes do not belong to this graph

      • otherNodes

        java.util.Set<Graph.Node<N,E>> otherNodes​(java.util.Set<Graph.Node<N,E>> group)
        Returns the set of nodes in the graph that are not in group. This is equivalent to getNodeSet().removeAll(group), but may be implemented differently.
        Parameters:
        group - a set of nodes
        Returns:
        all of the nodes of the graph not present in group

      • endpoints

        java.util.Set<Graph.Node<N,E>> endpoints​(java.util.Set<Graph.Edge<N,E>> edges)
        Returns the set of nodes including all and only those nodes that are one end or the other of the given set of edges.
        Parameters:
        edges - a set of edges
        Returns:
        a set of nodes that those edges are incident to

      • breadthFirstTraversal

        boolean breadthFirstTraversal​(Graph.Node<N,E> start,
                              Graph.Processor<N,E> processor)
        Performs a breadth-first traversal of a graph starting from the given node. As each node or edge is processed the appropriate method in the processor is invoked. The traversal will continue until all of the nodes have been traversed or the processor returns true, whichever happens first. The idea is that if, for instance, we are doing a search we can stop as soon as we find the desired node by returning true from the processor, at which point the traversal will also return true.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting node for the traversal
        processor - the processing object to be applied to each node/edge
        Returns:
        true if the processor ever returns true, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if the starting node is not a node of this graph

      • depthFirstTraversal

        boolean depthFirstTraversal​(Graph.Node<N,E> start,
                            Graph.Processor<N,E> processor)
        Performs a depth-first traversal of a graph starting from the given node. As each node or edge is processed the appropriate method in the processor is invoked. The traversal will continue until all of the nodes have been traversed or the processor returns true, whichever happens first. The idea is that if, for instance, we are doing a search we can stop as soon as we find the desired node by returning true from the processor, at which point the traversal will also return true.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting node for the traversal
        processor - the processing class to be applied to each node/edge
        Returns:
        true if the processor ever returns true, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Error - if the starting node is not a node of this graph

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString​()
        Returns a string representation of the graph.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the graph

      • validateGraph

        boolean validateGraph​()
        Verifies the internal consistency of the graph structure.
        Returns:
        true if consistent, false otherwise
